FreelanceText.0: I like to code things from scratch, and enjoy bringing ideas to life in the browser.

BackgroundText.0: Currently I work at Santander Bank as Frontend Developer and at Ironhack Bootcamp as Teacher Assistant

AcademicTimelineTitle.1: University of Applied Sciences - Frankfurt am Main

AcademicTimelineDescription.0: Bootcamp of Web Development. Subjects: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Node, Express, Mongo and REACT.
AcademicTimelineDescription.1: I got an government scholarship to study for one and half year at Germany. There, I studied at Fachhochshule Frankfurt am Main (University of Applied Sciences) electrical engineer in renewable energy field. I also did some subjects about programming, finances and business.
AcademicTimelineDescription.2: I studied electrical engineer, and there I made some volunteer work. Like 'Luz, Ciência e Emoção' and 'Projeto Lux'.

ProfessionalTimelineDescription.0: Helping the main teacher of Ironhack's part-time Web Development course. Subjects: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Node, Express, Mongo and REACT.
ProfessionalTimelineDescription.1: Current working at a startup of Santander: Empréstimos Sim. Using Vue.js, Typescript, Git, CSS
ProfessionalTimelineDescription.2: Worked at Santander and Sky clients, using Vue.js, Typescript, Git, CSS
ProfessionalTimelineDescription.3:
Intern at 'Talent Factory' program:
- Development of projects focused on quality improvement, performance and cost reduction
- Support of Head of Production with PDCA Cycle, 5S and Kaizen Methodology
- Experience in different positions at the factory, like Operator (working with weld spot), Senior Operator and Quality Analyst

AboutDescription.0: I made Electrical Engineering and after painful classes of C++, I was sure programming was not for me. When I graduated, I desired to work with something that I could use my love for technology and creativity to make my path a meaningful one. And guess what? I found myself in the programming world and I couldn't feel more engineer as I feel nowadays!
AboutDescription.1:
I started this project to learn how to make a website truly from scratch: buy a domain, create the layout, choose the technologies, develop everything, control version code, storage, evaluate SEO and performance, improve, improve, improve, and finally publish it!! What is being used in this project:
ㅤ- Javascript (with React)
ㅤ- HTML and CSS
ㅤ- Github
ㅤ- S3 and Cloudfront by Amazon Web Services (AWS)
ㅤ- i18next library to translate content.
Next steps: learn how to make deployment automation and more about improve site performance
